winget.name: Google Chrome
winget.description: Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google. It was first released in 2008 for Microsoft Windows, and was later ported to Linux, macOS, iOS and Android.

winget.name: Mozilla Firefox
winget.description: Mozilla Firefox is a free and open-source web browser developed by the Mozilla Foundation and its subsidiary, the Mozilla Corporation.

winget.name: LibreWolf
winget.description: LibreWolf is a privacy-oriented web browser based on Firefox. It is designed to be fast, lightweight, and secure.

winget.name: Firefox Developer Edition
winget.description: Firefox Developer Edition is a version of Firefox for developers. It includes the latest developer tools and experimental features, which are updated every six weeks.

winget.name: Waterfox
winget.description: Waterfox is a 64-bit version of the Firefox web browser, optimized for 64-bit Intel processors.

winget.name: Brave
winget.description: Brave is a free and open-source web browser developed by Brave Software, Inc. based on the Chromium web browser and its Blink rendering engine.

winget.name: Brave Dev
winget.description: Brave Dev is a free and open-source web browser developed by Brave Software, Inc. based on the Chromium web browser and its Blink rendering engine.

winget.name: Edge
winget.description: Microsoft Edge is a web browser developed by Microsoft. It was first released for Windows 10 and Xbox One in July 2015, and for Android and iOS in August 2017.

winget.name: Tor Browser
winget.description: Tor Browser is a web browser based on Mozilla Firefox ESR, configured to protect your anonymity when using the Internet.

winget.name: Vivaldi
winget.description: Vivaldi is a web browser developed by Vivaldi Technologies. It is based on Chromium and uses the Blink rendering engine.

winget.name: Opera Stable
winget.description: Opera is a web browser developed by Opera Software. It uses the Blink rendering engine and the WebKit layout engine.
